column5: Hit Twelve Mile Bay on Sat hoping to get out into the Bay and up towards Massassauga.  Well that didn't happen because of course, it's gotta be windy as hell.  So we ended up fishing the eastern end of Twelve Mile Bay with zero results..  Had a follow from a big pike near the end of the bay but that was about it..  Called it quits at 12 and made a run to Severn River to finish off the day.  First cast on the Severn landed me a small pike, maybe 3-4lbs..  That was about it for the day..  Sunday, got up and hit Gloucester for a try at crappies(First time fishing specifically for Crappie) That didn't work out either, one small perch for our efforts.  I'm really sick of this crap weather, can we please have a week straight of warm weather?  Pretty please with sugar on top?  June 7th will not come soon enough!
i hear ya... come on June 7th... 12 days and counting!
At least you're getting out there bud.  Rather be pulling in weeds than pushing paper, in any weather.  reefrunner
"A bad of fishing is better than a good day at work"  This week should warm everything up a bit... lets hope so
We did O.K. on the Moon but conditions are whaccky right now!
